alert.note: Alert for White Pine (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 1:58PM PDT until August 04 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Becky Peak burn scar in... Northeastern White Pine County in northeastern Nevada... * Until 300 PM PDT. * At 158 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Becky Peak Burn Scar. Between 0.1 and 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Becky Peak Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Becky Peak Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern White Pine County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
